creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
ERROR   (2004-11-18) 14:23.27:566   [sitemap] (/index.html) 
PoolThread-4/AbstractProcessingPipeline: Unabled to release processing component.
org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Unable to remove component from automatic
release: component not found.

(Reported by Gregor Rothfuss)
Under wich conditions you get this error? Can you post the steps you do to get it?
creator: agallardo@agsoftware.dnsalias.com

text:
compile lenya 1.2.1 with cocoon 2.1.6, and hit any page. the error is always
reproducible. the stack trace is actually much longer, and i also had some error
info in the jetty console. unfortunately i cannot test right now to paste the
rest of the error, but i pasted most of it on the dev list
creator: gregor@apache.org
gregor@apache.org

Jochen.Seifarth@web.de
text:
I got the same error on login as Rolf Kulemann reported.
I didn't get the error mentioned first at all and I don't get any errors when
browsing a presentation.

The issued seems to me like a problem with Xalan not being able to get what it
is looking for so I replaced the 2.6.x Xalan that comes with Cocoon 2.1.6 with
Xalan.2.6.0.jar and .... I was able to login.

However, straight after the login I get:

org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Unable to get transformer handler for
cocoon://lenya-page/default/authoring/index.xml?doctype=homepage:

(In reply to comment #6)
> I got the same error on login as Rolf Kulemann reported.
> I didn't get the error mentioned first at all and I don't get any errors when
> browsing a presentation.
> 
> The issued seems to me like a problem with Xalan not being able to get what it
> is looking for so I replaced the 2.6.x Xalan that comes with Cocoon 2.1.6 with
> Xalan.2.6.0.jar and .... I was able to login.
> 
> However, straight after the login I get:

Caused by: org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Exception in
ServerPagesGenerator.generate(): java.lang.NullPointerException

NPE in XSP are notorious, they can have lots of reasons. on the first page, it
could be the menu or the doctype matcher. can you try to login to the admin area
and the blog publication to narrow it down?

text:
i tried switching back from xsltc to xalan as default transformer, and i get
lots of 

Caused by: org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Error executing pipeline.:
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.EmptyStackException
	at
org.apache.cocoon.components.source.impl.SitemapSource.toSAX(SitemapSource.java:425)
	at
org.apache.excalibur.xml.xslt.XSLTProcessorImpl.sourceToSAX(XSLTProcessorImpl.java:359)
	at
org.apache.excalibur.xml.xslt.XSLTProcessorImpl.getTransformerHandlerAndValidity(XSLTProcessorImpl.java:276)
creator: gregor@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
I fixed the EmptyStackException thrown by Xalan (a i18n NS declaration was
missing). The login screen works with Xalan now, not yet with XSLTC.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
It works for me with Xalan now. There was a bug in the UsecaseMenuTransformer
and WorkflowMenuTransformer, they did not call super.setup() and therefore the
prefix mapping wasn't initialized correctly.

The XSLTC issue might be out of our scope. We could consider shipping our own
Xalan build.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #12)

> The XSLTC issue might be out of our scope. We could consider shipping our own
> Xalan build.

lets try if xsltc works with the xalan from 2.1.5. if it does then we can do as
you suggest. do you recall the xsl fixes you made in the trunk to make xsltc
happy? i recall the select="" -> select="''" , but im sure there are others.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
I'm currently trying to find the differences between 1.2 and 1.4, but didn't yet
succeed. When 1.4 works with 2.1.6, there should be a way to make 1.2 do so as well.

OK, I found the difference.
The trunk (1.4) uses Xalan by default :-(

  <map:transformers default="xslt">

    
    <map:transformer logger="sitemap.transformer.xslt" name="xslt" pool-grow="2"
pool-max="32" pool-min="8" src="org.apache.cocoon.transformation.TraxTransformer">
      <use-request-parameters>false</use-request-parameters>
      <use-session-parameters>false</use-session-parameters>
      <use-cookie-parameters>false</use-cookie-parameters>
      <xslt-processor-role>xalan</xslt-processor-role>
      <check-includes>true</check-includes>
    </map:transformer>

    
    <map:transformer logger="sitemap.transformer.xalan" name="xalan"
pool-grow="2" pool-max="32" pool-min="8"
src="org.apache.cocoon.transformation.TraxTransformer">
      <use-request-parameters>false</use-request-parameters>
      <use-session-parameters>false</use-session-parameters>
      <use-cookie-parameters>false</use-cookie-parameters>
      <xslt-processor-role>xalan</xslt-processor-role>
      <check-includes>true</check-includes>
    </map:transformer>

    
    <map:transformer logger="sitemap.transformer.xsltc" name="xsltc"
pool-grow="2" pool-max="32" pool-min="8"
src="org.apache.cocoon.transformation.TraxTransformer">
      <use-request-parameters>false</use-request-parameters>
      <use-session-parameters>false</use-session-parameters>
      <use-cookie-parameters>false</use-cookie-parameters>
      <xslt-processor-role>xsltc</xslt-processor-role>
      <check-includes>true</check-includes>
    </map:transformer>

...
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
Reduced the severity to "critical".

blocker: "Blocks development and/or testing work"
critical: "crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak"
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
